com.codecool.core

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.core.App

  • public class App
extends Object
    Implements an app functionality, updates app objects then renders them on the terminal screen.
    It's sets the terminal to raw mode to read input flawlessly, hides the cursor and refreshes the screen in every frame.
    More over it provides getInput()
    Use isDebug == true to stop the execution of the app on any keystroke.
    After instantiation or at runtime you can use:
    addAppObject(AppObject) addAnimation(AppObject) removeAppObject(AppObject) removeAnimation(AppObject)
    to add/remove app object(s) to/from the app.
    App object can be rendered to the screen from 1 to the given screen[dimension] - 1.

      • App

        public App(int screenWidth,
           int screenHeight,
           boolean isDebug)
        Constructs an App with the specified params.
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - the width of the screen.
        screenHeight - the height of the screen.
        isDebug - if it's true you can exit with any key stroke.

      • App

        public App(int screenWidth,
           int screenHeight,
           boolean isDebug,
           int stopDelay)
        Constructs an App with the specified params.
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - the width of the screen.
        screenHeight - the height of the screen.
        isDebug - if it's true you can exit with any key stroke.
        stopDelay - how many frames are rendered after stop() called.
